author: barnabemonnot
content: i had asked on another channel, maybe this is more suited here: is there a clean way to get a CSV of transactions included in blocks for 1559 yet? I was using ethereum-etl (https://github.com/blockchain-etl/ethereum-etl) to grab this from my node, it would be great to have the equivalent for 1559 txs

author: trent_vanepps
content: you could download the CSV from etherscan at Marius' address above?

author: barnabemonnot
content: I am also looking for the parameters, such as the maxFee, priorityFee, gas etc. ethereum-etl for instance dumps all the fields into CSV, and it's easier to do programmatically. I wasn't sure if someone had built something like this for 1559 yet. I might try and fork eth-etl otherwise
